qas.question: Which years did Nigeria win the African Cup of Nations?
When did Nigeria win a Summer Olympics gold medal?
What did Nigeria win a Summer Olympics gold medal for?
What country did Nigeria beat to win a Summer Olympics gold medal?
What is Nigeria's national football team called?

context: Football is largely considered the Nigeria's national sport and the country has its own Premier League of football. Nigeria's national football team, known as the "<a4_0>Super Eagles<a4_0/>", has made the World Cup on five occasions 1994, 1998, 2002, 2010, and most recently in 2014. In April 1994, the Super Eagles ranked 5th in the FIFA World Rankings, the highest ranking achieved by an African football team. They won the African Cup of Nations in <a0_0>1980, 1994, and 2013<a0_0/>, and have also hosted the U-17 & U-20 World Cup. They won the gold medal for <a2_0>football<a2_0/> in the <a1_0>1996<a1_0/> Summer Olympics (in which they beat <a3_0>Argentina<a3_0/>) becoming the first African football team to win gold in Olympic Football.
